definition: to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: Show me the props and extras.
sentences.chinese: 道具和臨時演員在哪兒？

sentences.english: We need hundreds of extras for the battle scenes.
sentences.chinese: 我們拍戰鬥場面需要上百的臨時演員。

sentences.english: Most of the ocean which extras were jumping into was 3 feet deep.
sentences.chinese: 臨時演員跳進去的“海都只有3英尺深。

sentences.english: We need several hundreds of partime actors to film the fighting scene.
sentences.chinese: 我們拍戰鬥場景需要幾百名臨時演員。

sentences.english: We need hundreds of extras for this scene。
sentences.chinese: 我們需要數百名臨時演員拍這場戲。

sentences.english: So extras were found at a halfway house, some of them real-life ex-cons.
sentences.chinese: 所以就在一家小客店裏找了許多臨時演員。

definition: lit. the lioness from Hedong roars (idiom)/fig. refers to a shrewish wife or a henpecked husband
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
(music) to change key/modulation/(of an employee) to be transferred to another post
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
